snippet: The case against the men, who were charged with kidnapping conspiracy, grew out of the prosecution of a New York police officer who was convicted of plotting to kidnap and eat women.
abstract: Robert C Asch and Richard Meltz are arrested in Manhattan by Federal Bureau of Investigation agents on charges that they plotted to kidnap and torture women; case grew out of the prosecution of New York Police Officer Gilberto Valle, who was convicted of plotting to kidnap and eat women.

byline.original: By JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

lead_paragraph: The case against the men, who were charged with kidnapping conspiracy, grew out of the prosecution of a New York police officer who was convicted of plotting to kidnap and eat women.

headline.seo: Two More Accused of Plotting to Kidnap, Torture and Kill Women
headline.main: Two More Are Accused of Plotting to Kidnap, Torture and Kill Women
headline.print_headline: Two More Are Accused of Plotting to Kidnap, Torture and Kill Women
